intro: Pedicularis qinghaiensis, commonly known as the Qinghai Himalayan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic growth habit and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces strikingly colorful, spurred flowers that range from red to yellow, often resembling small, delicate lanterns. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to the extreme conditions of its mountainous habitat. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
